Since we decided to take a day off, Akane\nimmediately rushed out of Tsubaki.%K%P
Maika had her own matters to tend to and left\nthe living room after clearing out the dishes.%K%P
Inori and I were left in the living room.%K%P
We weren't having deep a conversation, but I\ndidn't mind the mellow atmosphere either.%K%P
'Sho, would you like some tea?'%K%P
'You'll serve me some?'%K%P
'If you'll allow me.'%K%P
'Why, I'd love some please.'%K%P
'All right! Please wait a moment.'%K%P
As Inori slowly stood up and headed to the\nkitchen, she prepared the tea with experienced\nhands.%K%P
'Thank you for waiting.'%K%P
'Thank you very much.'%K%P
'Excuse me, I'm going to sit next to you.'%K%P
As Inori sat next to me, I caught a light peach-\nlike fragrance that tickled my nose.%K%P
I've been running around, working with Akane\nrecently, so this felt very relaxing.%K%P
'I'm very confident with this tea, I'm sure\nyou'll like it.'%K%P
'Really? Well then I'm excited.'%K%P
Urged by Inori, I took a sip of the tea.%K%P
'It's delicious.'%K%P
'I was taught by Maika how to do it. I'm glad it\nsuits your taste.'%K%P
As Inori smiled, it reminded me of what a\nharmonious goddess she was.%K%P
My eyes were stuck on her silky black hair, her\nquiet, elegant personality, and her magnificent\ncleavage...%K%P
'Um, you're staring at me. Is something wrong?'%K%P
'No, it's nothing. Anyway, you don't have any\nplans for today?'%K%P
'Me? Well, I'm thinking of going to the shrine.'%K%P
'The shrine? You mean where you're enshrined as\na goddess?'%K%P
'Yes. It's been a while since I went back. So\nI'm thinking of cleaning it today.'%K%P
'You're gonna clean your own shrine?'%K%P
'It's like how you clean your own room. That\nshrine belongs to me, so I should clean it\nmyself.'%K%P
I admired how modest Inori was, even as a\ngoddess.%K%P
'May I join you too?'%K%P
I decided to offer my help.%K%P
'Are you sure? There's nothing too special at my\nshrine.'%K%P
'I'm not expecting to hang out. I just want to\nhelp you.'%K%P
'You saved us many times during Akane's\nrehabilitation, so I'd like to take this chance\nto repay you.'%K%P
'Oh no, you're the one who's saved us many\ntimes. You don't need to repay me...'%K%P
'But, since you're being generous...may I take\nyou up on that offer?'%K%P
'Of course. We can clean your shrine together.'%K%P
'Heheh. Thank you very much.'%K%P
We smiled at each other as we finished the rest\nof the tea.%K%P
Inori's shrine was located on the corner of a\nresidential area.%K%P
'So this is your shrine. It's quite impressive.'%K%P
While it stood in the middle of the\nneighborhood, the area was spread out with lush\ntrees everywhere.%K%P
'Yes. It is quite the impressive shrine.'%K%P
Inori said this while puffed up with pride.%K%P
It really was a majestic shrine. Of course she'd\nbe proud of it.%K%P
I looked around again and noticed the many names\ncarved on the fence.%K%P
There were many stone pillars that formed a\nfence. They were carved with the names of\npeople, companies, and organizations.%K%P
'What's this, Inori?'%K%P
'Oh, those are the names of donors.'%K%P
Quite a number of groups and individuals had\ncontributed to her shrine.%K%P
'Inori, you're very loved by the people here as\na goddess.'%K%P
'Yes, to the point where I felt it was more than\nI deserved.'%K%P
'Heh, that's a good thing. The people of Kannagi\nknow what a great goddess you are.'%K%P
'I guess that's true. But because of that, I\nneed to work even harder.'%K%P
'I think you're working hard enough now.'%K%P
'No... I can't even rehabilitate an Aragami yet.\nI still have a long way to go. I need to devote\nmyself more.'%K%P
Inori was always diligent.%K%P
Seeing her work hard made me want to support\nher.%K%P
'If there's anything I can do, please let me\nknow.'%K%P
'Yes, if anything comes up, I'd like to count on\nyou, Sho.'%K%P
Inori then bowed her head.%K%P
How modest could a goddess get?%K%P
'I don't mean to be rude, but I have to thank\nAkane for running away.'%K%P
'Huh?'%K%P
'If Akane was serious about rehabilitation off\nthe bat, I don't think we would be living\ntogether like this.'%K%P
'Sorry, that's just my own, selfish opinion.'%K%P
'No... I don't think it's selfish at all. I have\na lot of fun living at Tsubaki Apartments too.'%K%P
I got so embarrassed seeing Inori looking up at\nme bashfully, I had to turn away.%K%P
'Um, sh-shall we get started on cleaning?'%K%P
'Yes. The bamboo broom is over here.'%K%P
My face was still red when I started to clean.%K%P
'I'll clean around the main shrine. Could you\nget the pathway?'%K%P
'Got it.'%K%P
'You can just gather the leaves near the front.'%K%P
'Okay, I'll start sweeping from the entrance.'%K%P
After I learned a few tips on how to use the\nbamboo broom, I started sweeping up the leaves\nfrom the entrance.%K%P
Hmm, using a bamboo broom is harder than using a\nregular one.%K%P
'Ah!'%K%P
'Inori?'%K%P
While I was trying my best to clean using the\nunfamiliar bamboo broom, I heard a scream.%K%P
When I turned around to see what happened...%K%P
'Uhh...'%K%P
Somehow, Inori ended up being half-clothed.%K%P
'Um... Inori? What are you doing?'%K%P
'The leaves went in my clothes! See, I-I'm\nhaving a hard time getting them out... Eek!'%K%P
'Wha?!'%K%P
As Inori squirmed, her clothes were slipping\ndown little by little.%K%P
'I can't get them by myself. Sorry Sho, can you\nhelp me?'%K%P
'H-Help you?!'%K%P
'Please. The leaves are itchy on my back and it\ntickles.'%K%P
'I'll take my clothes off so it's easier...'%K%P
'Wait! Stop! Stop! You're fine just like that.\nYou don't have to undress any further!'%K%P
'Are you sure? Okay.'%K%P
She stopped undressing as I requested, but she\nwas still half-dressed.%K%P
Inori's exposed skin was flawless, I couldn't\ntake my eyes off of it.%K%P
'S-So, where did the leaves go?'%K%P
'I'm pretty sure they're around the middle of my\nback.'%K%P
I went behind her and swallowed my breath. I was\nmesmerized by her beautiful nape.%K%P
D-Don't get any ideas.%K%P
Just focus on getting the leaves off of her.%K%P
'R-Right here?'%K%P
'Ah.'%K%P
I tried to avoid looking when I reached for\nInori's back, but I ended up touching her soft\nskin.%K%P
'Uhh... A little more to the right.'%K%P
D-Darn it. Inori's sensual voice was starting to\nget to me.%K%P
'Oh, hmm... J-Just a little l-lower.'%K%P
'Inori, please, I beg you, stop making those\nsounds.'%K%P
'I-I'm doing m-my best. Oh...ah...'%K%P
Keep your cool, just keep your cool.%K%P
I was just trying to get the leaves out. I\nwasn't doing anything weird.%K%P
'Mmm, mmm, ah, uh.'%K%P
'I-I found it! This is it. I'll get it out now.\nJust hang tight.'%K%P
'Oh...mm... That's ticklish...'%K%P
'Ah, ah...mm, hmm...'%K%P
'L-Look, Inori. I got it.'%K%P
'Th-Thank you so much... *Sigh*'%K%P
'Haha, don't worry about it...'%K%P
As I felt the exhaustion weighing down on me at\nonce, I went back to cleaning.%K%P
'Things are looking pretty good.'%K%P
We finished cleaning up the area.%K%P
'Yes. Let's call it a day and head home.'%K%P
'Oh, actually. Can I ask you something?'%K%P
'Is something the matter?'%K%P
I stopped Inori just as we were getting ready to\nleave.%K%P
We came all this way to the shrine. It'd be a\nwaste to just go back home.%K%P
'May I go and worship for a little while?'%K%P
'Worship, really?'%K%P
'Yes. Would it bother you?'%K%P
'Not at all! It's just... I've never been told\nthat to my face before, so I got a little\nembarrassed.'%K%P
'This is a first for me too. And I'm the one\nwho'll be worshiping in front of the real\ngoddess.'%K%P
We stood next to each other, facing the front of\nthe shrine.%K%P
'Here goes...'%K%P
I threw in my offering, rang the bell, bowed\ntwice, clapped twice, and then bowed one last\ntime.%K%P
'Sho, what did you wish for?'%K%P
'Would you like to know?'%K%P
'Only if you are willing to tell me.'%K%P
Seeing Inori's eyes beaming with high hopes,\nthere was no choice but for me to tell.%K%P
'I wished for the successful completion of your\nassignment.'%K%P
'Well, that's a very thoughtful wish of you,\nSho.'%K%P
'Really? I thought it was a pretty normal one.'%K%P
'People usually make wishes for themselves.'%K%P
'But, that was the wish I wanted to come true\nthe most. Was that bad...?'%K%P
'Of course not. I can assure you that your wish\nwill come true. Just you wait and see.'%K%P
'I'm looking forward to it. Now that the sun's\nsetting, shall we head back?'%K%P
'Yes. We don't want to be too late.'%K%P
We started walking side-by-side on the grounds\nlit by the evening sun.%K%P
'Sho.'%K%P
'What is it?'%K%P
'Thank you for helping today. Let's get back to\nworking hard again tomorrow.'%K%P
The smile she gave me at that moment was the\nmost beautiful one that day.%K%P
